meanings.definition: The quality or state of being penetrable.
meanings.sent1: The penetrabilities of the fabric allowed the water to seep through easily.
meanings.sent2: The explorers tested the penetrabilities of the cave walls by trying to pass through them.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cloak had such high penetrabilities that he could make objects disappear by hiding them inside.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a penetrability that could brighten even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The penetrabilities of the fog made it seem like a mysterious veil over the city.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be penetrated or entered.
meanings.sent1: The penetrabilities of the soil determined how deep the roots of the plants could grow.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith was impressed by the penetrabilities of the new security system.
meanings.sent3: The penetrabilities of the maze were so tricky that even the cleverest mouse got lost.
meanings.sent4: His words had a penetrability that reached deep into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The penetrabilities of the forest were explored by the hikers as they ventured deeper into the unknown.
